lines.content: This project makes use of AI assistance as part of the **A-AiAssisted increment**.
- Refactored classes to meet [SE-EDU / CS2103T Java coding conventions](https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/java/index.html).
- Suggested cleaner naming and small structural improvements.
- Added inline comments to explain validation logic and execution flow.
- Generated detailed Javadoc for classes and methods.
- Added clarifying in-code comments where needed.
- Produced an improved `AI.md` file (this file) to document AI use.
- Provided guidance and generated **JUnit 5 unit tests** for tricky methods and edge cases.
- Ensured tests covered input validation (e.g., blank descriptions, invalid indexes).
- Explained potential causes of failing tests.
- Proposed fixes for edge cases such as invalid task indexes and blank input handling.
- Helped improve error messages for user clarity.
- Suggested small UX improvements in the JavaFX GUI:
- Suggested clearer error messages and potential placeholder text.
- I carefully reviewed all AI-suggested improvements and edited them where necessary to ensure correctness, clarity, and compliance with module requirements.
- All final changes were tested, verified, and integrated into the codebase by me.

Add DialogBox.fxml and DialogBox.java to support chat bubble UI.
This encapsulates a single message with avatar and text so the
ListView can display rich dialog items for both user and bot.
[Level-10] Wire GUI to Bestbot backend and Ui overload
Integrate the existing Bestbot backend with the JavaFX UI by
a Bestbot instance into MainWindow after loading FXML so the
GUI can call backend logic without printing to the console.
Bestbot is a personal assistant chatbot inspired by *Duke*.
It helps you keep track of tasks such as **todos, deadlines, and events**; you can mark/unmark, delete, find tasks, and it saves progress automatically.
Adds a simple task without date/time attached.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Adds a task that must be done before a specific date.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task that happens at a specific time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.`
Displays all the tasks currently stored.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Sorts tasks in the list by deadline
Here is your sorted task list:
Marks a task in the list as completed.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### 7. Marking a task as not done
Marks a previously completed task as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a task from the list.
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
Searches tasks whose descriptions contain a given keyword.
`Here are the matching tasks in your list:
`Bye. Hope to see you again soon!`
Bestbot automatically saves tasks to the hard disk after any modification (add, delete, mark, unmark). On restart, your tasks are loaded from the saved file.
Bestbot handles invalid inputs gracefully and provides clear error messages.
â˜¹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.
- Headings made with `#`, `##`, `###` to organize sections.
- Code blocks use triple backticks (```) for commands and expected output.
- Images embedded via `![alt text](path)` with relative links.
If you find any bugs or want new features, feel free to open an issue or submit a PR.
Level-10: Implemented JavaFX GUI and merged to master
This tag marks the commit created by merging branch-Level-10 into
master. It includes DialogBox, MainWindow, backend integration,
Ui overload, styles, and resources for Level-10.
